title: Rapist attacked sleeping mum so violently she compared pain to childbirth
text:
Paul Wyatt-Davies ignored his victim’s pleas to stop, saying: ‘I wanted it, so I took it’ (Picture: SWNS)

A rapist took Viagra and attacked a sleeping mum so violently that she compared the ‘unbearable pain’ to childbirth.

Paul Wyatt-Davies, 34, from Worcester, will spend 18 months in prison after ignoring his victim’s pleas to stop, telling her: ‘I wanted it, so I took it.’

The victim woke up to find Wyatt-Davies, who had drank a bottle of wine and swallowed Viagra pills, having sex with her on March 27 this year.

She suffers from extreme anxiety and no longer likes leaving the house after the attack.

Giles Nelson, prosecuting, said the victim told police she had asked Wyatt-Davies to stop three times but he ‘didn’t at any stage stop’.

He said: ‘She was scared and in a state of shock. The really forceful attack lasted four minutes.

‘An empty packet of Viagra was later found discarded in a kitchen bin.

‘She described the pain as unbearable, described it as like childbirth pain.’

Wyatt-Davies admitted to rape at Worcester Crown Court on Monday (Picture: Getty Images)

Wyatt-Davies later apologised to his victim and admitted the rape as soon as he was arrested.

When asked why he’d done it, he replied ‘I just wanted it’, but told police he had thought ‘what have I done?’ after the rape.

He told the victim: ‘I’m truly sorry for what I’ve done to you. I’ve messed up big time.’

In a victim personal statement, the woman said she felt ‘desperately unhappy’ and ‘worried and paranoid’ after the attack.

Wyatt-Davies was jailed for three years after he admitted to rape at Worcester Crown Court on Monday.

He was told he would serve half his sentence in prison and the rest on licence.

He was also handed a restraining order, ordered to sign the sex offenders’ register and told to pay a £170 victim surcharge.

Judge Robert Juckes QC cited mitigating factors, including Wyatt-Davies’ previous good character.

The rapist was jailed for three years but will only serve half his sentence in prison (Picture: SWNS)

The judge said the rapist had been ‘aggressive’ when his victim confronted him, telling her ‘I wanted it, so I took it’ but added that he appeared ‘genuinely remorseful’.

He told him: ‘Thereafter your position has been contrite. You have expressed your regret.

‘You have given apologies. I have no hesitation at all in saying you are genuinely remorseful.

‘It was a serious sexual attack and had to be dealt with by way of a custodial sentence.

Dad knelt on pregnant ex's stomach as he punched her repeatedly

‘This is the most serious form of sexual attack.

‘The range available to the judge within the sentencing guidelines was a custodial sentence of between four and seven years and a starting point of five years in prison.

‘She told you to stop. You wouldn’t.

‘She was badly hurt and it went on for a long time and she suffered the consequences of that physically for one week and, emotionally and psychologically, she still suffers.’

description: Paul Wyatt-Davies, from Worcester, took Viagra and attacked a sleeping mum with such force, she compared the pain to childbirth.
